meanings.definition: A town undergoing rapid growth due to sudden prosperity, typically from a new industry or resource.
meanings.sent1: The boomtowns in the west grew quickly when gold was discovered.
meanings.sent2: Many boomtowns emerged during the oil rush in the early 20th century.
meanings.sent3: The boomtowns were so full of life and excitement, it felt like a never-ending party.
meanings.sent4: The sudden influx of people turned the small town into a bustling boomtown.
meanings.sent5: The image of boomtowns in old western movies is iconic and memorable.

meanings.definition: The period of rapid growth and prosperity experienced by a town.
meanings.sent1: After the new factory opened, the town entered a period of boomtowns.
meanings.sent2: The boomtowns of the 1920s were fueled by the success of the automobile industry.
meanings.sent3: During the boomtowns, everyone seemed to be in a hurry, rushing to seize opportunities.
meanings.sent4: The town's transformation into a boomtown was like watching a flower bloom in fast motion.
meanings.sent5: The excitement and energy of boomtowns are infectious and inspiring.
